member.summary: Enqueue commands to read from a buffer object to host memory.

The buffer to read from.
If the read and write operations are blocking or non-blocking
offset is the offset in bytes in the buffer object to read from or write to
The size of the data in bytes.
The buffer to read into.

The buffer to write to.

The offset in bytes in the buffer object to write to.
The size of the data in bytes.
The data to write from.

member.param: A pointer to the data pattern of size pattern_size in bytes.
pattern_size in bytes.

member.name: M:OpenCLDotNet.Core.CL.EnqueueCopyBuffer(OpenCLDotNet.Core.cl_command_queue,OpenCLDotNet.Core.cl_mem,OpenCLDotNet.Core.cl_mem,System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Enqueues a command to copy a buffer object to another buffer object.
member.param: The command-queue in which the copy command will be queued. The OpenCL context associated with command_queue, src_buffer, and dst_buffer must be the same.

The buffer to write to.

Refers to the size in bytes to copy.

member.name: M:OpenCLDotNet.Core.CL.CreateImage(OpenCLDotNet.Core.cl_context,OpenCLDotNet.Core.CL_MEM_FLAGS,OpenCLDotNet.Buffers.CLImageFormat,OpenCLDotNet.Buffers.CLImageDescription,System.UInt32,System.Array,OpenCLDotNet.Core.CL_ERROR@)
member.param: Refers to a valid buffer memory object if image_type is CL_MEM_OBJECT_IMAGE1D_BUFFER. Otherwise it must be NULL. For a 1D image buffer object, the image pixels are taken from the buffer object's data store. When the contents of a buffer object's data store are modified, those changes are reflected in the contents of the 1D image buffer object and vice-versa at corresponding sychronization points. The image_width * size of element in bytes must be â‰¤ size of buffer object data store..

member.name: F:OpenCLDotNet.Programs.CLProgram.OPTION_KERNEL_ARG_INFO
member.summary: Enables the kerenls argument info in the program to be available.

member.name: F:OpenCLDotNet.Programs.CLProgram.OPTION_SINGLE_PRECISION_CONSTANT
member.summary: Treat double precision floating-point constant as single precision constant.

member.name: F:OpenCLDotNet.Programs.CLProgram.OPTION_DENORMS_ARE_ZERO
member.summary: This option controls how single precision and double precision denormalized numbers are handled. If specified as a build option, the single precision denormalized numbers may be flushed to zero and if the optional extension for double precision is supported, double precision denormalized numbers may also be flushed to zero. This is intended to be a performance hint and the OpenCL compiler can choose not to flush denorms to zero if the device supports single precision (or double precision) denormalized numbers. This option is ignored for single precision numbers if the device does not support single precision denormalized numbers i.e.CL_FP_DENORM bit is not set in CL_DEVICE_SINGLE_FP_CONFIG. This option is ignored for double precision numbers if the device does not support double precision or if it does support double precison but CL_FP_DENORM bit is not set in CL_DEVICE_DOUBLE_FP_CONFIG. This flag only applies for scalar and vector single precision floating-point variables and computations on these floating-point variables inside a program.It does not apply to reading from or writing to image objects.

member.name: F:OpenCLDotNet.Programs.CLProgram.OPTION_OPT_DISABLE
member.summary: This option disables all optimizations. The default is optimizations are enabled.

member.name: F:OpenCLDotNet.Programs.CLProgram.OPTION_STRICT_ALIASING
member.summary: This option allows the compiler to assume the strictest aliasing rules.

member.name: F:OpenCLDotNet.Programs.CLProgram.OPTION_MAD_ENABLED
member.summary: Allow a * b + c to be replaced by a mad. The mad computes a * b + c with reduced accuracy. For example, some OpenCL devices implement mad as truncate the result of a * b before adding it to c.

member.name: F:OpenCLDotNet.Programs.CLProgram.OPTION_NO_SIGNED_ZEROS
member.summary: Allow optimizations for floating-point arithmetic that ignore the signedness of zero. IEEE 754 arithmetic specifies the behavior of distinct +0.0 and -0.0 values, which then prohibits simplification of expressions such as x+0.0 or 0.0*x (even with -clfinite-math only). This option implies that the sign of a zero result isn't significant.

member.name: F:OpenCLDotNet.Programs.CLProgram.OPTION_UNSAFE_MATH_OPTIMIZATIONS
member.summary: Allow optimizations for floating-point arithmetic that (a) assume that arguments and results are valid, (b) may violate IEEE 754 standard and (c) may violate the OpenCL numerical compliance requirements as defined in section 7.4 for single-precision floating-point, section 9.3.9 for double-precision floating-point, and edge case behavior in section 7.5. This option includes the -cl-no-signed-zeros and -cl-mad-enable options.

member.name: F:OpenCLDotNet.Programs.CLProgram.OPTION_FINITE_MATH_ONLY
member.summary: Allow optimizations for floating-point arithmetic that assume that arguments and results are not NaNs or Â±âˆž. This option may violate the OpenCL numerical compliance requirements defined in in section 7.4 for single-precision floating-point, section 9.3.9 for double-precision floating-point, and edge case behavior in section 7.5.

member.name: F:OpenCLDotNet.Programs.CLProgram.OPTION_FAST_RELAXED_MATH
member.summary: Sets the optimization options -cl-finite-math-only and -cl-unsafe-math-optimizations. This allows optimizations for floating-point arithmetic that may violate the IEEE 754 standard and the OpenCL numerical compliance requirements defined in the specification in section 7.4 for single-precision floating-point, section 9.3.9 for double-precision floating-point, and edge case behavior in section 7.5. This option causes the preprocessor macro __FAST_RELAXED_MATH__ to be defined in the OpenCL program.

member.name: F:OpenCLDotNet.Programs.CLProgram.OPTION_DISABLE_WARNINGS
member.summary: Inhibit all warning messages.

member.name: F:OpenCLDotNet.Programs.CLProgram.OPTION_WARNINGS_AS_ERRORS
member.summary: Make all warnings into errors.

member.name: M:OpenCLDotNet.Utility.ErrorUtil.CheckArray(System.Array,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Check a array that is passed to the c++ dll. If the array is invalid it will cause a hard crash. Array can be null if count is 0.
